result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

8:58 AM Defendant Joseph Lorenzo Wilson in court.  District Attorney Law Intern in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on August 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.

10:00 AM Defendant Joseph Lorenzo Wilson not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court notes there was no citation or summons mailed on this case and is uncertain the defendant had proper notice.  The Court will adjourn for an initial appearance and directs the State to send a summons to the defendant.  Initial appearance scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
